biotools.summary:
Simulated Annealing Single Cell inference (SASC) tool -- cancer progression inference.

SASC is a new model and a robust framework based on Simulated Annealing for the inference of cancer progression from the SCS data. The main objective is to overcome the limitations of the Infinite Sites Assumption by introducing a version of the k-Dollo parsimony model which indeed allows the deletion of mutations from the evolutionary history of the tumor.

bioschemas.name: SASC
bioschemas.summary:
Simulated Annealing Single Cell inference (SASC) tool -- cancer progression inference.

SASC is a new model and a robust framework based on Simulated Annealing for the inference of cancer progression from the SCS data. The main objective is to overcome the limitations of the Infinite Sites Assumption by introducing a version of the k-Dollo parsimony model which indeed allows the deletion of mutations from the evolutionary history of the tumor.
